episodeTitle: Time Limit - The Human Auction Begins
description: The human auction commences at Sabaody Archipelago. When the Straw Hats discover their friend Camie is being auctioned at Grove 1, they decide to buy her freedom. Meanwhile, news spreads across the archipelago about Ace's impending execution, threatening to spark a war with Whitebeard.

events.title: Ace's Execution Announced
events.description: News spreads across Sabaody Archipelago that the World Government plans to publicly execute Portgas D. Ace. X Drake recognizes this will provoke a war with Whitebeard, as the Marines are stretched thin preparing for the confrontation.
events.significance: This announcement sets the stage for the Marineford War, one of the most pivotal events in One Piece. It directly leads to the Summit War Saga and has massive implications for the world balance of power.

quotes.text: There is going to be a war. Whitebeard would surely retaliate against the World Government.
quotes.speaker: X Drake
quotes.context: X Drake's reaction upon learning about Ace's impending execution

events.title: Rayleigh Being Sold at Auction Revealed to Garp
events.description: At Marine Headquarters, a soldier reports to Vice Admiral Garp that Silvers Rayleigh, the Dark King and former first mate of Gol D. Roger, is one of the slaves being auctioned at Sabaody Archipelago. Garp bursts into laughter upon hearing this news.
events.significance: This reveals Rayleigh's presence at Sabaody and sets up his later importance in training Luffy. Garp's decision not to intervene shows the strategic restraint of the Marines as they prepare to face Whitebeard.

quotes.text: He probably is selling himself to pay off a gambling debt. He is not to be underestimated just because of his age - many good men could be hurt or worse if handled the wrong way.
quotes.speaker: Garp
quotes.context: Garp's assessment of the situation regarding Rayleigh at the auction

events.title: Straw Hats Arrive at Human Auctioning House
events.description: Franky, Nami, Chopper, Sanji, Hatchan, and Pappag arrive at the Human Auctioning House at Grove 1 to rescue Camie. They demand her return from the staff but are refused. The crew learns that Celestial Dragons are present, complicating their rescue plan.
events.significance: This moment forces the Straw Hats to confront the reality of the slave trade and the power of the World Nobles. Their decision to work within the auction system rather than attack directly shows strategic thinking, though it won't last long.

quotes.text: There are Celestial Dragons inside. There is also the matter of the exploding collar that is on Camie.
quotes.speaker: Hatchan
quotes.context: Hatchan explaining why they can't simply attack the auction house

events.title: Nami Decides to Buy Camie at Auction
events.description: After learning about the Celestial Dragons' presence and the exploding collar on Camie, Nami resolves to get Camie back through the auction system by purchasing her legally. Chopper stops Sanji from attacking the staff, and the crew agrees to this plan.
events.significance: This decision shows the crew's adaptability and Nami's leadership in the moment. It also demonstrates their willingness to spend their treasure to save a friend, setting up the bidding war in the next episode.

quotes.text: We'll get Camie back through their system. Money is not an issue.
quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Nami's determination to save Camie by any means necessary

events.title: Disco Begins the Human Auction
events.description: Disco, the flamboyant auctioneer of the Human Auctioning House, begins the monthly slave auction. He starts by selling the first slave for 600,000 belly, showing the market prices for different types of slaves to the audience.
events.significance: This scene establishes Disco as the face of the slave trade operation at Sabaody and introduces the horrific pricing system for human beings. It sets the dark tone for the auction sequence.

events.title: Slave Market Prices Revealed
events.description: Sanji is shown the market price list for different types of slaves, which angers him deeply. The pricing system commodifies human beings based on race, skill, and other attributes, revealing the cruel economics of the slave trade.
events.significance: This moment emphasizes the dehumanizing nature of slavery in the One Piece world and fuels the crew's moral outrage. It adds emotional weight to their mission to save Camie and sets up their eventual violent intervention.

events.title: Eustass Kid and Trafalgar Law at the Auction
events.description: The rival supernova pirates Eustass Kid and Trafalgar Law are revealed to be in attendance at the auction house with their crews. Heat brings the Straw Hats' arrival to Kid's attention, who notes that Luffy is not yet present.
events.significance: This gathering of multiple Worst Generation members at the auction house foreshadows the chaos to come and establishes the supernovas as witnesses to the Straw Hats' defiance of the World Nobles.

quotes.text: Compared to the callowness of greedy authority figures, the criminals of the world have much more humanity. It's because scum rule the world that new scum is born.
quotes.speaker: Eustass Kid
quotes.context: Kid's cynical philosophy about the nature of authority and criminality

events.title: Celestial Dragons Arrive at Auction
events.description: Saint Rosward arrives at the Human Auctioning House with his children Saint Charlos and Saint Shalria. Their presence prevents the Straw Hats from using force to rescue Camie due to the consequences of harming World Nobles.
events.significance: The arrival of the Celestial Dragons raises the stakes dramatically and introduces some of the series' most despicable antagonists. Their presence is the primary obstacle preventing a direct rescue attempt.

events.title: Zoro Lost and Asking for Directions
events.description: Zoro is shown surrounded by pirates with their swords drawn, asking where Grove 1 is. A pirate attempts to attack but is frightened by Zoro's intimidating glare, dropping his sword and pointing him in the right direction instead.
events.significance: This comedic moment provides levity while reinforcing Zoro's terrible sense of direction and his fearsome reputation. It also shows he's still trying to reach the auction house.

events.title: Peterman Identified as Camie's Kidnapper
events.description: Usopp talks to the man who caught the giant slave and finds out that a mermaid has been brought to the auction house. They inform the rest of the crew that the kidnapper is Peterman, the head of the Hound Pets kidnapping gang.
events.significance: This confirms Camie's location at the auction house and identifies Peterman as the culprit behind her kidnapping, giving the crew concrete information about their enemy.

events.title: Duval Arrives with Sanji
events.description: Duval arrives at the auction house alongside Sanji, showing his continued alliance with the Straw Hats after the events at the archipelago.
events.significance: Duval's presence demonstrates the allies the Straw Hats have made at Sabaody and adds to their numbers for the potential rescue operation.

quotes.text: There is going to be a war. Whitebeard would surely retaliate against the World Government.
quotes.speaker: X Drake
quotes.context: Reacting to news of Ace's execution

quotes.text: He probably is selling himself to pay off a gambling debt. He is not to be underestimated just because of his age - many good men could be hurt or worse if handled the wrong way.
quotes.speaker: Garp
quotes.context: Assessing the situation with Rayleigh at the auction

quotes.text: There are Celestial Dragons inside. There is also the matter of the exploding collar that is on Camie.
quotes.speaker: Hatchan

quotes.text: We'll get Camie back through their system. Money is not an issue.
quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Deciding to buy Camie at auction

quotes.text: Compared to the callowness of greedy authority figures, the criminals of the world have much more humanity. It's because scum rule the world that new scum is born.
quotes.speaker: Eustass Kid
quotes.context: Kid's philosophy on authority and crime at the auction house

themes.description: The episode confronts the horrific reality of the slave trade at Sabaody Archipelago, showing the commodification of human beings and the moral outrage it provokes.
themes.symbolism: The auction house represents systemic oppression and the way power structures dehumanize the powerless. The pricing system for slaves symbolizes the reduction of people to mere commodities.

themes.description: The episode explores the conflict between true justice and corrupt authority through the Celestial Dragons' involvement in the slave trade and Eustass Kid's cynical observations about those in power.
themes.symbolism: The Celestial Dragons represent absolute authority without accountability, while the pirates represent those who see through the hypocrisy of the system.

themes.description: The Straw Hats' determination to save Camie, even if it means spending all their money or risking conflict with the World Government, demonstrates their loyalty to friends.
themes.symbolism: Nami's willingness to spend money (her typical weakness) shows how far the crew has come in valuing friendship over treasure.

themes.description: Multiple world-shaking events are set in motion: Ace's execution announcement, the gathering of supernovas, and the Celestial Dragons at the auction. The episode builds tension for the explosive events to come.
themes.symbolism: The auction house becomes a powder keg where multiple explosive elements converge.

characterSpotlights.development: Nami takes charge of the rescue operation and makes the strategic decision to work within the auction system, showing her growth as a leader and tactician.
keyActions: Decides to buy Camie at auction
Declares money is not an issue for saving a friend
Coordinates with the crew on their approach
quotes: We'll get Camie back through their system. Money is not an issue.

characterSpotlights.development: Garp demonstrates his tactical acumen by choosing not to engage Rayleigh while the Marines prepare for war with Whitebeard, showing the weight of his responsibilities.
keyActions: Receives intelligence about Rayleigh at the auction
Orders subordinates to keep the information quiet
quotes: He probably is selling himself to pay off a gambling debt. He is not to be underestimated just because of his age - many good men could be hurt or worse if handled the wrong way.

characterSpotlights.development: X Drake shows his analytical mind by immediately understanding the implications of Ace's execution and predicting the coming war.
keyActions: Recognizes the Marines are preparing for war
quotes: There is going to be a war. Whitebeard would surely retaliate against the World Government.

characterSpotlights.development: Kid's presence at the auction and his philosophical observations establish his worldview and set him up as a foil to Luffy's more optimistic approach to piracy.
keyActions: Comments on the corruption of authority
quotes: Compared to the callowness of greedy authority figures, the criminals of the world have much more humanity. It's because scum rule the world that new scum is born.

mangaDifferences.difference: The episode corresponds to Chapter 501 pages 2-19, with some extended scenes and pacing adjustments typical of anime adaptation.

trivia.fact: This is the first episode to use 'Share the World' by TVXQ (Tohoshinki) as the opening theme, marking a significant change in the series' musical identity.

sources.title: Share the World - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: This episode marked the first One Piece episode broadcast within the 'Dream 9' Sunday morning programming block, alongside the Dragon Ball Kai premiere.
Rayleigh's scheme of selling himself at auctions to rob his buyers is revealed to have been going on for over 20 years, showing his cleverness and resourcefulness.

Episode 395 has an IMDb rating of 7.9/10, making it one of the lower-rated episodes in the highly-acclaimed Sabaody Archipelago arc, likely because it's primarily setup for the explosive episodes 396-397.

sources.title: One Piece: The 10 Best Episodes Of The Sabaody Archipelago Arc (According To IMDb)

trivia.fact: This episode features multiple members of the Worst Generation (Luffy, Zoro, Law, Kid, X Drake) in different locations, all converging on or reacting to events at Sabaody Archipelago.
